cs.IT, cs.NT, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the operation of data links that employ incremental redundancy as a means to protect information from unreliable channels. This topic falls under the domain of information theory (cs.IT). The paper also establishes a connection between random coding and well-known constants in number theory, which suggests that it may belong to the sub-category of number theory (cs.NT). The paper also discusses the impact of coding strategy and channel erasure on throughput, which could be relevant to the sub-categories of signal processing (cs.SI) and distributed systems (cs.DS). Finally, the paper proposes a methodology for selecting code rates and block lengths for incremental redundancy, which could be relevant to the sub-category of computer communication (cs.CC).
